result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC >=0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC >=0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Glenn A Roach was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$500.00 cash bond to be applied.  Remaining $75.50 cash bond in Case No. 16CM168 and $250.00 cash bond in Case No. 16CM167 to be applied.
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

11/14/16:  FINE AMOUNT CORRECTED TO INCLUDE THE COST OF THE MANDATORY DNA SURCHARGE.

Sentence to begin immediately.
Huber granted.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Glenn A Roach in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers 16CM167, 16CM168 and 16CM169.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

16CM168:  Count 2 - Guilty plea entered.

16CM169:  State moves to amend Count 2 to OWI 2nd offense - Granted.  Guilty plea entered.

All other charges, 16CM167, 16TR1042, 16TR1043 and 16TR1044 are all Dismissed.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Attorney Krische relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

16CM168
.218 BAC
$924.50 forfeiture - 60 DTP
7 month DL revocation
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Ignition interlock 12 months

16CM169
.218 BAC nonaggravated
$1,492 fine - 60 DTP
14 month DL revocation
Ignition interlock 14 months
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
10 days jail - Credit for 6 days - Huber granted - Sentence to begin immediately
  
Cash bond posted in any of the above cases to be applied to forfeitures and fines.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Jail faxed

(Clerked by APavick)
Attorney Matthew Krische in court.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 16CM167, 16CM168, 16CM169, 16TR1043, 16TR1044 and 16TR1042

2:07 Atty. Krische relates.  All above reset to 10/31/16 before Judge Babler.
Bond(s) to continue.

  Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Glenn A Roach
Current: 687 S Mill Street #17, Barron, WI 54812 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2016)
Prior: E6487 1370th Avenue, Ridgeland, WI 54763 United States

Defendant Glenn A Roach in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM167, 16CM168, 16CM169, 16TR1042, 16TR1043 and 16TR1044 called.  Attorney Krische requests bond modification to remove or amend PBT condition in OWI cases.  State objects.  Court modifies bond to eliminate daily PBT requirement; however weekly PBT at Community Counseling Service must be performed and Community Counseling Services must notify Barron County District Attorney Office of any positive tests.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

(THE $500 CASH BOND TO BE POSTED IN THIS CASE IS IN ADDITION TO ANY AMOUNTS POSTED IN OTHER CASES)

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Must submit to daily PBTs at Barron County Sheriff's Dept. at 6:00 PM.

07/27/2016 AMENDED: COURT ELIMINATES THE DAILY PBT REQUIREMENT; HOWEVER A WEEKLY PBT AT COMMUNITY COUNSELING SERVICES MUST BE PERFORMED AND COMMUNITY COUNSELING SERVICES MUST NOTIFY BARRON COUNTY DISTRICT ATTTORNEY OFFICE OF ANY POSITIVE TESTS.

Defendant Glenn A Roach in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 16CM167, 16CM168, 16CM169, 16TR1043 AND 16TR1044. Cases reset. Any citations not defaulted shall track along. Defaulted citations shall not be cross-referenced.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
